statements.name: PROC HPFEXMSPEC
statements.description: The HPFEXMSPEC procedure creates model specifications files for external models (EXM). External model specifications are used for forecasts that are provided external to the system. These external forecasts might have originated from an external statistical model from another software package, might have been provided by an outside organization (for example, a marketing organization or government agency), or might be based on judgment.
statements.help:
PROC HPFEXMSPEC <LABEL=SAS-label> <NAME=SAS-name> <REPOSITORY=SAS-catalog-name | SAS-file-reference>;     
	EXM <MEDIAN> <METHOD=<NONE | WN | ACF>... > <NLAGPCT=number> ...;

arguments.name: LABEL=
arguments.description: Labels the model specification to be stored in the SAS catalog or external file reference.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: Names the model specification to be stored in the SAS catalog or external file reference.

arguments.name: REPOSITORY=
arguments.description: Names the SAS catalog or external file reference to contain the model specification.

statements.name: EXM
statements.description: The EXM statement specifies an external model that is used to generate the external forecasts. These options are not needed if the prediction standard errors and confidence limits are provided.

arguments.name: MEDIAN
arguments.description: Specifies that the median forecast values were used to generate the external forecasts. The external forecasts can have been based on the mean or median. By default the mean value is assumed.

arguments.name: METHOD=
arguments.description: Specifies the external model to be used to approximate the prediction standard errors. The default is METHOD=ACF.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: No prediction error autocorrelation is used.

arguments.name: WN
arguments.description: Prediction error autocorrelation is white noise.

arguments.name: ACF
arguments.description: Autocorrelation is used.

arguments.name: ERRORACF
arguments.description: Prediction error autocorrelation is used.

arguments.name: PERFECT
arguments.description: Perfect autocorrelation is assumed.

arguments.name: NLAGPCT=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of time lags as a percentage of the number of computed predictions errors. The default is NLAGPCT=0.25.

arguments.name: NOEST
arguments.description: Specifies that the external model parameters are fixed values. To use this option, all of the external model parameters must be explicitly specified. By default, the external model parameters are optimized.

arguments.name: NPARMS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of parameters used by the external model to generate the forecasts. The default is NPARMS=0.

arguments.name: SIGMA=
arguments.description: Specifies the prediction standard error for the external model.

arguments.name: TRANSFORM=
arguments.description: Specifies the time series transformation that was applied to the actual time series when generating the external forecast.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: No transformation

arguments.name: LOG
arguments.description: Logarithmic transformation

arguments.name: SQRT
arguments.description: Square-root transformation

arguments.name: LOGISTIC
arguments.description: Logistic transformation

arguments.name: BOXCOX
